CatDescriptText: Gus Johnson, 1939 Irwin Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 25, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think there would be less juvenile delinquency if the father were restored to his original role as sole head of the house?" answer reads: "Yes, there would be less. The reason is that the father sees more traveling to and from work, than the wife.  Most wives are confined in home.  With the husband observing more, he will be that much more able to raise his own."
TitMainTitle: Gus Johnson wearing zippered jacket and hat with brim inscribed "Vic Agnew Inc.,"  facing man, possibly George Barbour writing on notepad, standing in front of Fanny Farmer candy store, Wood Street, Downtown
